position: Software Engineer @ Morgan Stanley | Java | Angular | Apache Kafka | Azure

positions.subtitle: Morgan Stanley
positions.description: • Engineered a Kafka stream-based automatic payment release functionality, reducing average payment release time from30 minutes to 4 minutes, optimizing operational efficiency and processing over 80K transactions per day.
positions.title: Software Engineer
positions.description_html:
• Engineered a Kafka stream-based automatic payment release functionality, reducing average payment release time from
30 minutes to 4 minutes, optimizing operational efficiency and processing over 80K transactions per day.

positions.subtitle: Morgan Stanley
positions.description: • Enhanced reference data availability on Kafka by developing a Spring Boot application with an Angular Frontend, reducing new reference data onboarding time by 50%, improving data accessibility for over 10 teams.• Served as Scrum Master for a year, facilitating sprint planning, daily standups, and retrospectives, and driving on-time delivery of multiple projects while fostering a culture of continuous improvement within a team of five engineers.
positions.title: Manager / Software Engineer
positions.description_html:
• Enhanced reference data availability on Kafka by developing a Spring Boot application with an Angular Frontend, reducing new reference data onboarding time by 50%, improving data accessibility for over 10 teams.
• Served as Scrum Master for a year, facilitating sprint planning, daily standups, and retrospectives, and driving on-time delivery of multiple projects while fostering a culture of continuous improvement within a team of five engineers.

positions.subtitle: Morgan Stanley
positions.description: • Leading various technical debt remediation initiatives like decommissioning legacy components bringing $100,000 savings per year.• Integrating the new Kafka infrastructure to receive real-time balances of payments, so that the payment release is more accurate (avoiding overdraft) and quicker.
